Jesus, she’s a good girl

4 fret capo

C C# Am C F C D F

C# C And so it seems,

C# Am C F I will see you once again

D In my dreams. It’s sort of strange, You only haunt me when i’m trying To leave you behind.

Why you always make me a liar When i’m trying to tell the truth. Jesus, she’s a good girl I don’t want to hurt her.

The whisperings In the middle of the morn Liquor rests

Upon your words But still in my slow beating heart I’m not ashamed. Oh maybe i In the rising morning light Should be blamed.

Why you always call me a liar When i’m trying to tell the truth. Jesus, she’s a good girl I don’t want to hurt her.
